perturbation.original_text: "APPLICATION" means the English version of the E.piphany Application programs listed in Exhibit A, in object code format, any accompanying Documentation, and any Updates (as defined in Section 5.5 ("Updates"), only if and when generally commercially available as part of the Maintenance Services provided pursuant to Section 5 ("Maintenance Services").
perturbation.changed_text: "APPLICATION" means the E.piphany Application programs listed in Exhibit A, in object code format, any accompanying Documentation.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to 'Updates' and their definition in Section 5.5, while Section 5 still refers to 'Updates', this creates an internal contradiction. The contract now lacks clarity on what constitutes an 'Update' and how it relates to the maintenance services.

perturbation.original_text:
5.  MAINTENANCE

5.1 FOR HSNS UNDER LICENSES. E.piphany will provide the Maintenance described below, provided HSNS remains a compliant subscriber to such Maintenance and has paid all monies due therefor. Upon reasonable notice, E.piphany reserves the right to modify the terms and conditions of Maintenance, provided that any such modification will not substantially diminish the level of Maintenance that HSNS is then currently receiving.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.  MAINTENANCE

5.1 FOR HSNS UNDER LICENSES. E.piphany will provide Maintenance. Upon reasonable notice, E.piphany reserves the right to modify the terms and conditions of Maintenance.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause 'described below, provided HSNS remains a compliant subscriber to such Maintenance and has paid all monies due therefor. provided that any such modification will not substantially diminish the level of Maintenance that HSNS is then currently receiving.', the obligation of E.piphany to provide Maintenance, and HSNS's obligation to pay for it, becomes ambiguous. This omission contradicts Section 3, which outlines payment terms, and creates uncertainty on whether HSNS is entitled to maintenance if they have not paid for it.

perturbation.original_text: 2.1 ANNUAL REPORTS. On the thirtieth (30th) day after the end of each of the first two years of this Agreement, HSNS shall submit to E.piphany a report (in a form provided by E.piphany and reasonably acceptable to HSNS) listing&bbsp;(i) the total number of emails distributed for Years 1 and 2 and (ii) the Application with which the Outsourcing Services are rendered. Year 2 and Year 3 Quarterly Payments, as defined in Exhibit "A," shall be based upon these annual reports. All reporting and payment requirements under this Section shall be subject to the audit requirements of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 ANNUAL REPORTS. On the thirtieth (30th) day after the end of each of the first two years of this Agreement, HSNS shall submit to E.piphany a report (in a form provided by E.piphany and reasonably acceptable to HSNS) listing&bbsp;(i) the total number of emails distributed for Years 1 and 2 and (ii) the Application with which the Outsourcing Services are rendered. All reporting and payment requirements under this Section shall be subject to the audit requirements of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the sentence 'Year 2 and Year 3 Quarterly Payments, as defined in Exhibit "A," shall be based upon these annual reports', a contradiction is created. The requirement to provide annual reports remains, but the explicit link between those reports and the payments defined in Exhibit A is removed. This makes the payment calculation method unclear, given Exhibit A references these reports for payment adjustments. It undermines the enforceability of the payment terms in exhibit A.
